nodes.text: This is the place that exhibited the old form of justice. Before the Sundering, the Ancient Eulex disputed mortal charges and sin. One would enter a trial by combat, allowing the favor of their Ancient to serve as arbiter, against the accuser. This could even be invoked for petty charges.

options.text: Goodness.
How does this reconcile with Daethos proclaiming providence?
How come this isn't in practice anymore?
Not to cut this short, but could I trouble you for your wares?
I'm intrigued. How does this work, exactly?
Oh my. Show me the roster.

nodes.text: It does seem that it would be cross, and it brings up the worship adhering to the Ancients as opposed to Daethos. However, trial by combat was seen as a legitimate form of exculpation due to many of the trials taking place between worshippers of different ancients, and one could proclaim Daethos as exceptional and before all being. The Eulex meant to poise your belief against your adversary's, and retains this honor with the advent of Daethos.

options.text: What is the Ancient Eulex, again?

nodes.text: With the proliferation of Daethos, the practice of trial by combat had waned since its use to show favor of a single Ancient was seen as a perversion to the blessing of Daethos and our providence. Not to mention the Ancients role in the Sundering, with some regions--even within majority adherent provinces, seeing it as heretical.

nodes.text:
This is an action roleplaying game. As you may have noted, you've created a character and entered this world without much explanation, but I am here to guide you further.

With its emphasis being combat, this game invites you to learn its combat system and your abilities, and tailor your preferred style against its denizens. It's experimental with 10 actions, metered by 2 resources, a fair jump in complexity concerning mobile users, but less than many desktop rpgs demand.

Find and utilize better equipment as you gain strength from defeating enemies. Speak and build relationships while awaiting the upcoming Ascea, a grand tournament featuring the greatest people across the land, competing in tests of fitness and warfare to gain adoration, alliances, renown, and riches.

nodes.text: Very well. Good luck to you in the encounter, ${ascean.name}. Speak to me again when you are finished.

The game starts with mobile in mind; twin joysticks for movement and aiming (ranged and specials).

The left joystick allows you to move your character, and the right is used for certain special abilities and manual targeting if you have it enabled in the settings menu.

However, in desktop, the keyboard and mouse are both modular and can be used for either movement or actions.

nodes.text:
The Physical and Special action buttons allow you to perform damage in combat.

Physically, everyone is capable of swinging their weapon and/or shooting projectiles, in addition to forms of evasion with dodge and roll.

With Specials, you are restricted to your current 'mastery', and perform specialized abilities that can heal yourself, directly damage the enemy, or control them via magical effects.

Clicking on your name, your character in-game, or toggling the book menu and clicking on the first 'player' icon will all lead you to the main settings menu.

From here, you can tab and change multiple options for gameplay concerns, including but not limited to: enemy aggression, special capability, and movement speed.
